snippet: The plans for reunions between families separated by a tense border suggest that ties could be improving between the two countries.
abstract: North and South Korea agree to hold family reunions Feb 20-25, in which hundreds of elderly relatives separated by the Korean War will meet for the first time in six decades; North and South Koreans held their last family reunions in 2010, after which humanitarian program was halted amid souring relations; revival of reunions suggests rival governments are edging toward improving relations
lead_paragraph: The plans for reunions between families separated by a tense border suggest that ties could be improving between the two countries.

headline.main: North and South Korea Set Dates for Family Reunions
headline.print_headline: North and South Korea Set Dates for Family Reunions
